Avoiding Plagiarism and Citing Sources

Created by Kian Ravaei, Taylor Harper, Jacy Black

Affiliated with UCLA?

If you are affiliated with UCLA and would like to receive certification of completion for this workshop, be sure to Log in and Enroll in WI+RE's CCLE site before completing this workshop.

Not affiliated with UCLA?

No problem! All of our workshops and activities are open access and freely available to all! Enjoy the activities!

About this workshop
Awards and Recognition

This workshop has received a 5-star editor review on MERLOT, a curated collection of online learning and support materials.
Authors

Kian Ravaei, Taylor Harper, Jacy Black

Contributors

April Zhou, Doug Worsham, Nisha Mody, Alicia Reiley, Alana Enriquez, Gavin Jackson, Hanna Young, Jacelyn Omusi, Lou Baya Ould Rouis, Valeria Morales, Simon Lee, Renee Romero

Learning Outcomes
  • Identify strategies for avoiding plagiarism
  • Accurately cite sources in a consistent style
  • Summarize, paraphrase, and directly quote a text
